titleStmt.title: J. A. Moss et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9955

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Excellency Bariah Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioners respectfully represent that t the June term 1860 of the Henderson Circuit Court -- Samuel J. Howard and John G. Hicks were indicted for an assault alledged to have been committed on the person of one John Green -- which indictment was heard and tried at the December term 1860 of said court when sd Howard ^and Hicks^ were fined each the sum of thrity dollars -- The only witness who appeared to testify in behalf of the Commonwealth was said John Green -- who in his testimony stated that he didnt know that Hicks struck him, but he looked around and saw a stick lying on the ground near Hicks -- and this statement together with the fact of Hickss presence was all that in any way tended to implicate him in the assault -- since the trial of the Cause. Hicks has ascertained for the first time that he can prove by a credible witness that
the witness knew previous to the trial of the cause admitted that Hicks never assaulted or struck him -- This fact though recently discovered -- your petitioners are advised, would not entitle him to a new hearing of the case in as much as it would tend only to impeach the witness green -- Your Excellency is earnestly urged and requested to interpose in behalf of Mr Hicks the Executive clemency and remit so much of said fine as the law permits

J. A. Moss
W, H Taylor
Wm, H,, Robards
Wm G Taylor
N. M. Hicks
John M Dennis
A. J. Goode
J m Goode

I heard John Green say previous to the trial of the indictment mentioned that Hicks did not strike him of which I gave Hicks no information until after the trial

John C Stapp
